snippet: Fayza Abul Naga, who led a criminal case against American nonprofit groups, will be national security adviser to President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.
abstract: Egyptian Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi appoints as security adviser Fayza Abul Naga, who in 2012 spearheaded criminal charges that nonprofit groups were acting as agents of American conspiracy to weaken and destabilize Egypt; analysts say Abul Naga’s return underscores Sisi government’s persistent disregard for its alliance with Washington, as well as darkly suspicious view of civil organizations.
lead_paragraph: Fayza Abul Naga, who led a criminal case against American nonprofit groups, will be national security adviser to President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.

headline.main: Egypt Elevates an Official Hostile to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Egypt Elevates an Official Hostile to U.S.
